en: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Zophar Naamath mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a;

en: Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be justified?
hmr: “Thu tamtakhai hi dawn a ni ngei naw ding am a nih? Mi ṭawng tam chu thiem inchangtir a ni ding am a nih?

en: Should thy boastings make men hold their peace? And when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
hmr: Chatlakloa i ṭawng hin mihai ân to ṭawktir ding am a nih? Thamlo taka i ṭawng hin tukhawmin an sukzak naw ding che i ring maw?

en: For thou sayest, My doctrine is pure, And I am clean in thine eyes.
hmr: ‘Ka thuring chu ân thiengin, I mithmua chun kân thieng a nih,’ i ti sih a.

en: But oh that God would speak, And open his lips against thee,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw, Pathien chun hung hrilin, Nanga kalin a hmûrhai chu hung inchângtir ve sienla;

en: And that he would show thee the secrets of wisdom! For he is manifold in understanding. Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
hmr: Varna thurûkhai chu ân entir ding che bah! Varna chu sîr tamtak a ni si a, Pathien chun i khawhlonain a phu nêka nêp lemin a thaw che a nih ti hre rawh.

en: Canst thou by searching find out God? Canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
hmr: A zawnga zawng ngawtin Pathien thil inthûkhai chu i hmu suok thei ding am a nih? Iengkimthawthei chu a famkimin i hmu suok thei ding am a nih?

en: It is high as heaven; what canst thou do? Deeper than Sheol; what canst thou know?
hmr: Vân ang ela insâng a nih; nangin ieng am thaw thei i ta? Seol nêka inthûk lem a nih; nangin ieng am hre thei i ta?

en: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, And broader than the sea.
hmr: Chu chu lienzie chu leihnuoi nêkin a sei lemin; Tuisuoriet nêkin a lien lem a nih.

en: If he pass through, and shut up, And call unto judgment, then who can hinder him?
hmr: Ama chu a fêthleng a, a khârkhip a, A ko khâwm chun tuin am dang thei an ta?

en: For he knoweth false men: He seeth iniquity also, even though he consider it not.
hmr: Mi teplohai chu a hrietin, A ngaituo naw khawma, khawhlonahai chu a hmu sih a.

en: But vain man is void of understanding, Yea, man is born as a wild ass’s colt.
hmr: Ram sabengtungtê mihriema a pieng phaleh, Mi teplo chun hrietthiemna nei chau a tih.

en: If thou set thy heart aright, And stretch out thy hands toward him;
hmr: I lungril chu i siem dik a, Ama tiengah i kuthai i phar chun;

en: If iniquity be in thy hand, put it far away, And let not unrighteousness dwell in thy tents.
hmr: I kuta chun khawhlona a um ruok chun, hlatakah sie dai rawh, I puon inahai chun fel nawna inchêngtir naw la;

en: Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; Yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
hmr: Chun, matheiloin i hmai chu kaidum um hlek loin nghâng i ta, Anih, dettakin um i ta, ṭi naw ti ni.

en: For thou shalt forget thy misery; Thou shalt remember it as waters that are passed away,
hmr: I rinum tuorhai chu i theinghil ta âwm sih a; Tui luong hmang tahai ang chau chun hre zing i tih.

en: And thy life shall be clearer than the noonday; Though there be darkness, it shall be as the morning.
hmr: Chun, i hringna chu sûnchang lai nêkin hung fie lem a ta, Inthimna um sien khawm, zîngkâr ang ni tâng a tih.

en: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; Yea, thou shalt search about thee, and shalt take thy rest in safety.
hmr: Chun, beiseina a um leiin, nang chu him tâng i ta, Anih, nangma le nangma inzawng suok i ta, himtakin sâwldam tâng i tih.

en: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; Yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
hmr: Zâl i ta, tukhawma suklâu bawk naw ni hai che; Anih, mi tamtakin nangma le inremna hung siem an tih.

en: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, And they shall have no way to flee; And their hope shall be the giving up of the ghost.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi rilo mithai chu hung hlawsam a ta, Tlân hmangna ding lampui khawm nei naw ni hai, An beiseina khawm chu thlarau inthla ang chu nîng a tih,” tiin.
